definition: lit. to want sth in haste, but cannot get there (idiom, from Analects); more haste, less speed/don't try to run before you can walk
to wish for/to desire/variant of 慾|欲[yu4]
fast/rapid/quick/velocity
(conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items
(negative prefix)/not/no
surname Da
to attain/to reach/to amount to/to communicate/eminent

sentences.english: Remember the old saw, haste makes waste.
You must constantly bear in mind that haste makes waste.
sentences.chinese: 你須將“欲速則不達”一語常記心中。

sentences.english: 'More haste, less speed' is a paradox.
sentences.chinese: “欲速則不達”是似非而是的雋語。

definition: too far is as bad as not enough (idiom, from the Analects)
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
to seek the cause in oneself rather than sb else
irreverent
to have a sense of shame
to advance prematurely
to be strict with oneself
to plan matters/to look for a job
compassion/empathetic
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
to emerge victorious in every battle/to be ever-victorious
